content.question: A student is given two <math alttext="10 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> samples, each a mixture of only <math alttext="N a C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="K C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> but in different proportions. Which of the following pieces of information could be used to determine which mixture has the higher proportion of <math alttext="K C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>Â ?

choices.label: The mass of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></math> in each mixture

The number of isotopes of <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></math>
The reaction of each mixture with water

content.answer: The mass of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></math> in each mixture

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
